abstract_summ: Afterwards we identified single nucleotide variants in the Bangladeshi isolate, using the Wuhan virus reference sequence.Continuous monitoring and analysis of the sequences of new cases from India and the other affected countries would be vital to understand the genetic evolution and rates of substitution of the SARS-CoV-2.A previously unknown coronavirus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has been shown to cause coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.This study would also help to understand the virulence factors, disease pathogenicity, origin and transmission of the SARS-CoV2.Recently the first genome sequence for a Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 or SARS-CoV-2 isolate from Bangladesh became available.Genomic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 in Taiwan revealed a new ORF8-deletion mutant and a virus clade that may be associated with infections in the Middle East, which contributed to a better understanding of the global SARS-CoV-2 transmission dynamics.Sequencing reads were mapped to the Wuhan reference genome and compared to eleven other SARS-CoV-2 strains of Asian, European and American origins.
title_summ: Origin of imported SARS-CoV-2 strains in The Gambia identified from Whole Genome SequencesOn spatial molecular arrangements of SARS-CoV2 genomes of Indian patientsGenome Analysis of SARS-CoV-2 Isolate from BangladeshFull-genome sequences of the first two SARS-CoV-2 viruses from IndiaIdentification of the nucleotide substitutions in 62 SARS-CoV-2 sequences from TurkeySARS-CoV-2 genomic surveillance in Taiwan revealed novel ORF8-deletion mutant and clade possibly associated with infections in Middle East.
title_abstract_phrases: Continuous monitoring and analysis of the sequences of new cases from India and the other affected countries would be vital to understand the genetic evolution and rates of substitution of the SARS-CoV-2.Identification of the nucleotide substitutions in 62 SARS-CoV-2 sequences from TurkeyA previously unknown coronavirus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has been shown to cause coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.Afterwards we identified single nucleotide variants in the Bangladeshi isolate, using the Wuhan virus reference sequence.This study would also help to understand the virulence factors, disease pathogenicity, origin and transmission of the SARS-CoV2.Genome Analysis of SARS-CoV-2 Isolate from BangladeshRecently the first genome sequence for a Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 or SARS-CoV-2 isolate from Bangladesh became available.Origin of imported SARS-CoV-2 strains in The Gambia identified from Whole Genome SequencesSevere Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a positive-sense single stranded RNA virus with high human transmissibility.Full-genome sequences of the first two SARS-CoV-2 viruses from IndiaBACKGROUND & OBJECTIVES: Since December 2019, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has globally affected 195 countries.
